title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 2166/98 of 8 October 1998 fixing, for the 1997/98 marketing year, the amount to be paid by the sugar manufacturers to the beet sellers in respect of the difference between the maximum amount of the B levy and the amount of that levy
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 2166/98 of 8 October 1998 fixing, for the 1997/98 marketing year, the amount to be paid by the sugar manufacturers to the beet sellers in respect of the difference between the maximum amount of the B levy and the amount of that levy
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The amount referred to in Article 29(2) of Regulation (EEC) No 1785/81 to be paid by the sugar manufacturers to the beet sellers in respect of the B levy shall be fixed for the 1997/98 marketing year at ECU 0,30 per tonne of beet of the standard quality.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 October 1998.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
